titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Student Organizations Web Collection MC.375
titlestmt.author: Nicole Greenhouse

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-05 14:37:41 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: New York University Student Organizations Web Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains websites related to the online presence of student organizations and student activities at New York University, the bulk of which come from 2013-2015.
did.langmaterial: Websites are in English, Chinese, Japanese and Korean.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University Student Organizations Web Collection; RG 39; Wayback URL; University Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Series I: Student Blogs
Series II: Student Organization Event Ephemera
Series III: Student Organization News
Series IV: Online Communities

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Facebook is inconsistently captured and plays back. Majority of 2022 Facebook crawls were performed with Webrecorder to resolve capture problems from initial captures.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Websites were initially selected by Aleksandr Gelfand from September 2013-January 2014 through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Intial description and processing of this collection was performed in Archive-It by Aleksandr Gelfand and Shannon McDonald in circa 2014. The collection is made up of four Archive-It collections: Student Blogs Web Archive, Student Organization Event Ephemera Web Archive, Student Organization News Web Archive, and Online Communities Web Archive. In 2022, the four collections were arranged into four series in ArchivesSpace and description was standardized across the collection.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored. FourSquare was blocked from capture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains websites related to student organizations and activities at New York University, the bulk of which come from 2013-2015. Blogs and other websites cover news from around the university and New York City, as well as advice for current and prospective students. Some websites cover events that student organization put together, as well as NYU student organizations in the news. News coverage includes topics such as NYU Greek life, NYU alumni, the Objectivist Club, and LGBTQIA+ community. Events include music and theater performances, club meetings, fundraisers, and conferences. There are many Facebook pages in this collection, modelled off websites and blogs such as Craigslist Missed Connections, Humans of New York, or Overheard in New York but about NYU and its students.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This collection was created by the University Archives in 2013 to collect a sampling of student organization activities in the mid 2010s. The websites in the collection were derived from club lists found at the Office of Student Affairs, yearbooks, and Google search results.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Websites are arranged in the order in which they were added to the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of blogs documenting the student experience at NYU.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: https://nyulocal.com/ is accrued monthly. https://meet.nyu.edu/ is accrued quarterly.

did.unittitle: Free and Public Events at NYU

dao.xlink:title: Free and Public Events at NYU Archived Website

daodesc.p: Free and Public Events at NYU Archived Website: October 2013-July 2014

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This blog lists many of the free and public events held on and around the NYU campus, including conferences, lectures, book signings, screenings, concerts, and more. Blog dates from 2008-2014.

dao.xlink:title: Spring in New York 2013 Archived Website

daodesc.p: Spring in New York 2013 Archived Website: October 2013

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Spring in New York blog is a supplement to the Spring in New York University website and is intended to be the visiting student's preparation guide for coming to NYU for the spring term. Dates from 2012-2013.

dao.xlink:title: Meet NYU Archived Website

daodesc.p: Meet NYU Archived Website: December 2019-ongoing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meet NYU is a blog produced by New York University Admissions intended to aid students in the application process by educating them about resources and providing advice. It includes videos and posts on application advice, information on campus resources, city life, communities and clubs, athletics, civic engagement, academics, study abroad, research, faculty, the Washington Square and Downtown Brooklyn campuses.

did.unittitle: Series II: Student Organization Event Ephemera

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Websites are arranged in the order in which they were added to the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of event announcements held by NYU's student organizations.

daodesc.p: Film Remix 2006 Project Archived Website: September 2013

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The goal of the NYU remix project is to choose one of the given trilogies and "edit down the footage into a parody of the original, adding or removing elements (voiceovers, scenes, etc) as necessary."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Websites are arranged in the order in which they were added to the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series consists of news stories relating to NYU's student organizations and their activities. The series represents a sampling of news from 2013-2015.
